sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"计划"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: plan, design, plot, scheme, project, blueprint, programme
means: plan ： 最普通常用词，多指事先经过较充分的准备或考虑后制定的计划，也可指非决定性的打算或设想。
design ： 侧重指按照目标、目的意向，根据固定格式精心作出的计划或安排。
plot ： 主要指为实现某一阴谋而拟定秘密的计划。
scheme ： 普通用词，比plan更强调计划的通盘筹划和某些细节的精心安排。在现代英语中，常用于指阴谋诡计。
project ： 多指由个人或集体为进行某项工作或完成某一项较大的任务，而制定的计划方案或设想。
blueprint ： 从本义蓝图，引申指详细而具体的行动计划。
programme ： 使用广泛，既可指思想上的计划，又可指任何形式的书面计划或规划。

stems_affixes.value_cn: 计划, 设计图, 平面图

means.word_mean: 计划, 打算, 方案

sentences.en: Your plan sounds fine in theory, but will it work?
sentences.cn: 你的计划在理论上听起来不错, 但行得通吗?

sentences.en: They devised a plan to rob a bank.
sentences.cn: 他们策划抢劫银行。

sentences.en: The plans of the new development are on show at the town hall.
sentences.cn: 镇公所大厅展示了新开发的平面图。

means.word_mean: 计划, 打算, 设计

sentences.en: It's better to plan if you want arrangements to be really efficient.
sentences.cn: 如果你希望有个紧凑的安排, 最好事先做个计划。

sentences.en: I have planned the whole thing to the smallest detail.
sentences.cn: 我已经把整个事情连最小的细节都计划好了。

sentences.en: What do you plan to do during the holidays?
sentences.cn: 你打算在假期里做什么?

sentences.en: I planned going myself.
sentences.cn: 我打算亲自去。

sentences.en: He began to plan what he would do with his Sundays.
sentences.cn: 他开始计划星期天的活动。</seg>

data.mean: point out (to sb); point sth↔out (to sb); （向某人）指出

sentence.cn: 生物学家克里斯汀（Kristin）表示，该计划是要观察今年夏天鸟类对五彩缤纷的道路的反应。
sentence.en: Biologist kristin says the plan is to see how the birds respond to the multi-colored road this summer.
sentence.from: 2019年高考英语全国卷I 听力 原文

sentence.cn: 在那一刻，我做出了决定：我将制定并遵循自己的人生成长规划。
sentence.en: And at that moment,  I made the decision: I will develop and follow a personal growth plan for my life.
sentence.from: 2016年高考英语江苏卷 完形填空 原文

jx.jx_en_mean: a person's (or the) most sensible course of action
happen as one arranged or intended
(S. African)devise a way of overcoming difficulties

phrase.cizu_name: plan of action (或 campaign 或 attack)

jx.jx_en_mean: an organized programme of measures to be taken in order to achieve a goal

entry.def: A plan is a method of achieving something that you have worked out in detail beforehand.

example.ex: The three leaders had worked out a peace plan...
example.tran: 3位领导人已制订出了一个和平方案。

example.ex: The project is part of a United Nations plan for refugees.
example.tran: 该项目是联合国难民计划的一部分。

entry.def: If you plan what you are going to do, you decide in detail what you are going to do, and you intend to do it.

example.ex: If you plan what you're going to eat, you reduce your chances of overeating...
example.tran: 如果计划一下要吃什么，就有可能不会吃得过多。

example.ex: He planned to leave Baghdad on Monday...
example.tran: 他计划周一离开巴格达。

entry.def: If you have plans, you are intending to do a particular thing.
entry.tran: （有做某一特定事的）计划，打算，意向

example.ex: 'I'm sorry,' she said. 'I have plans for tonight.'
The government is making plans to evacuate more than two hundred of its citizens from the troubled area.
example.tran: 政府打算疏散200多名留在骚乱地区的公民。

entry.def: When you plan something that you are going to make, build, or create, you decide what the main parts of it will be and do a drawing of how it should be made.
entry.tran: 设计；绘制…的图样（或图表）

example.ex: We are planning a new kitchen.

entry.def: A plan of something that is going to be built or made is a detailed diagram or drawing of it.

example.ex: ...when you have drawn a plan of the garden.
example.tran: 当你画出花园的平面图后

means.word_mean: 1. a series of steps to be carried out or goals to be accomplished;

sentences.sentence: "they discussed plans for a new bond issue"
"the awkward design of the keyboard made operation difficult"
"it was an excellent design for living"
"the plans for City Hall were on file"

means.word_mean: 1. have the will and intention to carry out some action;

sentences.sentence: "He plans to be in graduate school next year"
"The rebels had planned turmoil and confusion"
"He is planning a trip with his family"

means.word_mean: 3. make or work out a plan for; devise;
4. make a design of; plan out in systematic, often graphic form;

sentences.sentence: "plan the new wing of the museum"

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: from French, from earlier plant 'ground plan, plane surface', influenced in sense by Italian pianta 'plan of building'. Compare with plant
